channel.title: Network-Security on Gharib Personal Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Network-Security on Gharib Personal Blog

item.title: China is Still Inside US Networks — It’s Been SIX Months
item.description:
Hell froze over: FBI and NSA recommend you use strong encryption.

The post China is Still Inside US Networks — It’s Been SIX Months appeared first on Security Boulevard.

item.title: Enterprise Juniper routers subjected to malware campaign
item.description:
Installation of the malware in targeted routers facilitates the deployment of a cd00r variant scanning for five network signals, which when received triggers reverse shell creation on the local file system, enabling device takeover, data exfiltration, and additional malware compromise, according to an investigation by Black Lotus Labs researchers.

Go to Source

item.title: New Chinese cyberespionage campaign targeted South Korean VPN service
item.description:
Execution of a trojanized installer triggers deployment of a loader with another DLL eventually resulting in the running of SlowStepper, which supports commands enabling extensive system info theft, file deletion, Python module execution, and self-deletion, an analysis from ESET revealed.

Go to Source

item.title: Widespread AIRASHI botnet detailed in new report
item.description:
Aside from the zero-day, threat actors behind AIRASHI also leveraged more than a dozen other security flaws impacting AVTECH IP cameras, Shenzhen TVT appliances, and other devices dating as far back as 2013, a report from QiAnXin XLab researchers showed.

Go to Source

item.title: AIs in Love, UEFI, Fortinet, Godaddy, Juggalos, Aaran Leyland, and More. - SWN #443
Over 15K Fortinet FortiGate firewalls' data exposed
item.description:
Included in the exposed firewall data are IP addresses, passwords, and configuration files, said Belsen Group in its post on the hacking forum.

Go to Source

item.title: 4.2 million internet hosts hijacked via bugs in tunneling protocols
item.description:
Attackers gain network access by targeting VPN servers, home, and enterprise routers.

Go to Source

item.title: Woe Daddy: FTC raps hosting giant GoDaddy for security lapses
item.description:
GoDaddy must adhere to a number of security compliance requirements by the FTC.
